oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Joseph Lusk to Adaline Davis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter written from Joseph N. B. Lusk to his future wife, Adaline Davis. At the time the letter was written, Lusk served in Co. I, 43rd Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. He deserted that unit, along with his two brothers, on May 11,1862. He enlisted in the Union; army on May 22, 1862 joining the 7th East Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA and later the 1st Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA under the command of Robert Johnson and James Patton Brownlow, respectively. The letter mentions that many of the men lack weapons.
